content.description: Scientists studying a wild population of mantled howler monkeys found the average birth rate to be <math alttext="0.22" overflow="scroll"> <mstyle> <mrow> <mn>0.22</mn> </mrow> </mstyle> </math> and the average death rate to be <math alttext="0.12" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>0.12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. At the start of the study, the population consisted of <math alttext="13" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> monkeys.
content.question: Assuming no immigration or emigration, which of the following best describes the change in population size that will occur over the next year?

choices.label: The population size will decrease because a population of <math alttext="13" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>13</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> is too small to sustain itself.
The population will decrease because more monkeys are dying each year than are being born.
The population will increase exponentially because it is so small that there are likely few competitors and abundant resources.
The population will increase because more monkeys are being born each year than are dying.

content.answer: The population will increase because more monkeys are being born each year than are dying.
